revised_title: Investigation of Radiation Accompanying Electron Scattering in Incandescent Solids
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to search for radiation emitted during the scattering of slow electrons at the surface of incandescent solids. They found no appreciable radiation in the visible and ordinary ultra-violet range under the conditions for which characteristic energy losses by scattered electrons have been observed. This study did not investigate the spectral region beyond the ultra-violet frequency limit.
